Remember this week in 6 months when people ask me "why don't you play Greedier anymore?"
@MadRubicant Sadly not allowed! The good news is I already got it working last night, just interested if there was a one-step sol'n instead
@TylerGlaiel shots fired
@ephemeralvision The simple real world solution is just using a string instead of cin, I imagine
@ephemeralvision For this particular problem it is an artificial constraint. I got it working but just curious if there's a simpler way
@Tanjoodo Awesome, this is a big help. Thank you!
@Drakxii @SpooderW This is also true
@Tanjoodo Oh man, really? Is ws included in iostream?
@SpooderW well, I would rather know how to make a menu than use the input buffer. Don't pump my tires too hard!
Is there really no way to flush the cin buffer in C++ short of calling cin.ignore(int,char)?
